column4: Can anyone help me with port forwarding so i can check the status of torrents in Transmission when away from home?
you want a remote access to transmission?
why transmission?
yes, i do :)
becuse that is the one that comes with Ubuntu, and it works fairly well.. light weight etc
i would most likely go with rtorrent, personally
no ideas then?
i know there are web front ends for rtorrent AND ktorrent
i bet there exists a web interface for transmission, but i would be hard pressed to use it for ubuntu
it is incredibly light weight, too much so
there is a web interface.. a fairly good one. by defualt, it is at 'YoutIP':9091/transmission/web
ok, so from the outside it says this port is closed?
and this is your problem??
if you've enabled port forwarding and set the port and IP correctly, and if your IP has not changed, then the only suggestion I would make is to bridge your modem
what is bridging? and how would i do it?
you need access to the modem, and then you set its mode to "Bridge"
i dont know your set up, i assume you have modem -> router -> laptop
hmm.. i will have a look. thank you
np
its more like.. web > router > wireless home network
is your modem also your router?
yes, it is. and i can't find a thing for turning on bridging
yes, it is. and i can't find a thing for turning on bridging
